description: TestWorkflowTemplate is the Schema for the workflows API

apiVersion.description:
APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object.
Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and
may reject unrecognized values.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description:
Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents.
Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to.
Cannot be updated.
In CamelCase.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

after.description: steps to run at the end of the workflow

paths.description: paths to fetch from the container

workingDir.description: working directory to override, so it will be used as a base dir

condition.description:
expression to declare under which conditions the step should be run
defaults to: "passed", except artifacts where it defaults to "always"

container.description: defaults for the containers in this step

args.description: override default command in the image (empty string to default CMD of the image)

command.description: override default command in the image (empty string to default ENTRYPOINT of the image)

image.description: image to be used for the container

workingDir.description: override default working directory in the image (empty string to default WORKDIR for the image)

content.description: content that should be fetched for this step

mode.description: mode to use for the file

path.description: path where the file should be accessible at

cone.description: enable cone mode for sparse checkout with paths

mountPath.description: where to mount the fetched repository contents (defaults to "repo" directory in the data volume)

paths.description: paths to fetch for the sparse checkout

revision.description: branch, commit or a tag name to fetch

sshKey.description: plain text SSH private key to fetch with

sshKeyFrom.description: external SSH private key to fetch with

token.description: plain text token to fetch with

username.description: plain text username to fetch with

tarball.description: tarballs to unpack

mount.description: should it mount a new volume there

path.description: path where the tarball should be extracted

url.description: url for the tarball to extract

async.description: only schedule the resources, don't watch the results (unless it is needed for parallelism)

parallelism.description: how many resources could be scheduled in parallel

count.description: static number of sharded instances to spawn

activeDeadlineSeconds.description:
Optional duration in seconds the pod may be active on the node relative to
StartTime before the system will actively try to mark it failed and kill associated containers.
Value must be a positive integer.

args.description: additional executor binary arguments

artifactRequest.description: artifact request body with test artifacts

masks.description: regexp to filter scraped artifacts, single or comma separated

omitFolderPerExecution.description: don't use a separate folder for execution artifacts

sharedBetweenPods.description: whether to share volume between pods

sidecarScraper.description: run scraper as pod sidecar container

storageClassName.description: artifact storage class name for container executor

useDefaultStorageClassName.description: whether to use default storage class name

volumeMountPath.description: artifact volume mount path for container executor

command.description: executor binary command

mapToVariables.description: whether we shoud map to variables from resource

reference.description:
LocalObjectReference contains enough information to let you locate the
referenced object inside the same namespace.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

mapToVariables.description: whether we shoud map to variables from resource

reference.description:
LocalObjectReference contains enough information to let you locate the
referenced object inside the same namespace.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

executePostRunScriptBeforeScraping.description: execute post run script before scraping (prebuilt executor only)

executionNamespace.description: namespace for test execution (Pro edition only)

image.description: container executor image

items.description:
LocalObjectReference contains enough information to let you locate the
referenced object inside the same namespace.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

negativeTest.description: negative test will fail the execution if it is a success and it will succeed if it is a failure

postRunScript.description: script to run after test execution

preRunScript.description: script to run before test execution

sourceScripts.description: run scripts using source command (container executor only)

sync.description: whether to start execution sync or async

valueFrom.description: or load it from var source

variablesFile.description: variables file content - need to be in format for particular executor (e.g. postman envs file)

matrix.description: matrix of parameters to spawn instances (static)

maxCount.description: dynamic number of sharded instances to spawn - it will be lowered if there is not enough sharded values

shards.description: parameters that should be distributed across sharded instances

tarball.description: pack some data from the original file system to serve them down

config.description: configuration to pass for the workflow

count.description: static number of sharded instances to spawn

description.description: test workflow execution description to display

optional.description: is the step optional, so its failure won't affect the TestWorkflow result

imagePullSecrets.description: references to secrets with credentials for pulling the images from registry

items.description:
LocalObjectReference contains enough information to let you locate the
referenced object inside the same namespace.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

labels.description: labels added to the scheduled pod

nodeName.description: NodeName is a request to schedule this pod onto a specific node.

nodeSelector.description: node selector to define on which node the pod should land

preemptionPolicy.description: PreemptionPolicy is the Policy for preempting pods with lower priority.

priority.description: The priority value. Various system components use this field to find the priority of the pod.

priorityClassName.description: If specified, indicates the pod's priority.

serviceAccountName.description: default service account name for the scheduled pod

subdomain.description: If specified, the fully qualified Pod hostname will be "<hostname>.<subdomain>.<pod namespace>.svc.<cluster domain>".

restartPolicy.description: Restart policy for the main container in the pod. One of OnFailure or Never.

shards.description: parameters that should be distributed across sharded instances

shell.description: script to run in a default shell for the container

workingDir.description: override default working directory in the image (empty string to default WORKDIR for the image)

services.description: list of accompanying services to start

setup.description: steps to run before other operations in this step

shell.description: script to run in a default shell for the container

timeout.description: maximum time this step may take

workingDir.description: working directory to use for this step

default.description: default value - if not provided, the parameter is required

enum.description: the list of allowed values, when limited

multipleOf.description: the number needs to be multiple of this value

sensitive.description: whether this value should be stored in the secret

config.description: make the instance configurable with some input data for scheduling it

container.description: defaults for the containers for all the TestWorkflow steps

tarball.description: pack some data from the original file system to serve them down

logs.description: should save logs for the parallel step (true if not specified)

matrix.description: matrix of parameters to spawn instances (static)

maxCount.description: dynamic number of sharded instances to spawn - it will be lowered if there is not enough sharded values

negative.description: is the step expected to fail

optional.description: is the step optional, so its failure won't affect the TestWorkflow result

parallelism.description: how many resources could be scheduled in parallel

count.description: how many times at most it should retry

until.description: until when it should retry (defaults to: "passed")

run.description: run specific container in the current step

args.description: override default command in the image (empty string to default CMD of the image)

command.description: override default command in the image (empty string to default ENTRYPOINT of the image)

image.description: image to be used for the container

shell.description: script to run in a default shell for the container

workingDir.description: override default working directory in the image (empty string to default WORKDIR for the image)

shards.description: parameters that should be distributed across sharded instances

shell.description: script to run in a default shell for the container

timeout.description: maximum time this step may take

pure.description: mark the step as pure, applying optimizations to merge the containers together

count.description: how many times at most it should retry

until.description: until when it should retry (defaults to: "passed")

run.description: run specific container in the current step

args.description: override default command in the image (empty string to default CMD of the image)

command.description: override default command in the image (empty string to default ENTRYPOINT of the image)

image.description: image to be used for the container

shell.description: script to run in a default shell for the container

workingDir.description: override default working directory in the image (empty string to default WORKDIR for the image)

args.description: override default command in the image (empty string to default CMD of the image)

command.description: override default command in the image (empty string to default ENTRYPOINT of the image)

content.description: global content that should be fetched into all containers

mode.description: mode to use for the file

path.description: path where the file should be accessible at

cone.description: enable cone mode for sparse checkout with paths

mountPath.description: where to mount the fetched repository contents (defaults to "repo" directory in the data volume)

paths.description: paths to fetch for the sparse checkout

revision.description: branch, commit or a tag name to fetch

sshKey.description: plain text SSH private key to fetch with

sshKeyFrom.description: external SSH private key to fetch with

token.description: plain text token to fetch with

username.description: plain text username to fetch with

tarball.description: tarballs to unpack

mount.description: should it mount a new volume there

path.description: path where the tarball should be extracted

url.description: url for the tarball to extract

count.description: static number of sharded instances to spawn

image.description: image to be used for the container

logs.description: should save logs for the service (false if not specified)

matrix.description: matrix of parameters to spawn instances (static)

maxCount.description: dynamic number of sharded instances to spawn - it will be lowered if there is not enough sharded values

activeDeadlineSeconds.description: duration in seconds the pod may be active on the node

annotations.description: annotations added to the scheduled pod

hostname.description: Specifies the hostname of the Pod

imagePullSecrets.description: references to secrets with credentials for pulling the images from registry

items.description:
LocalObjectReference contains enough information to let you locate the
referenced object inside the same namespace.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

labels.description: labels added to the scheduled pod

nodeName.description: NodeName is a request to schedule this pod onto a specific node.

nodeSelector.description: node selector to define on which node the pod should land

preemptionPolicy.description: PreemptionPolicy is the Policy for preempting pods with lower priority.

priority.description: The priority value. Various system components use this field to find the priority of the pod.

priorityClassName.description: If specified, indicates the pod's priority.

serviceAccountName.description: default service account name for the scheduled pod

subdomain.description: If specified, the fully qualified Pod hostname will be "<hostname>.<subdomain>.<pod namespace>.svc.<cluster domain>".

restartPolicy.description: Restart policy for the main container in the pod. One of OnFailure or Never.

shards.description: parameters that should be distributed across sharded instances

shell.description: script to run in a default shell for the container

workingDir.description: override default working directory in the image (empty string to default WORKDIR for the image)

services.description: list of accompanying services to start

setup.description: steps to run before other operations in this step

shell.description: script to run in a default shell for the container

timeout.description: maximum time this step may take

workingDir.description: working directory to use for this step

steps.description: steps to execute in the workflow

paths.description: paths to fetch from the container

workingDir.description: working directory to override, so it will be used as a base dir

condition.description:
expression to declare under which conditions the step should be run
defaults to: "passed", except artifacts where it defaults to "always"

container.description: defaults for the containers in this step

args.description: override default command in the image (empty string to default CMD of the image)

command.description: override default command in the image (empty string to default ENTRYPOINT of the image)

image.description: image to be used for the container

workingDir.description: override default working directory in the image (empty string to default WORKDIR for the image)

content.description: content that should be fetched for this step

mode.description: mode to use for the file

path.description: path where the file should be accessible at

cone.description: enable cone mode for sparse checkout with paths

mountPath.description: where to mount the fetched repository contents (defaults to "repo" directory in the data volume)

paths.description: paths to fetch for the sparse checkout

revision.description: branch, commit or a tag name to fetch

sshKey.description: plain text SSH private key to fetch with

sshKeyFrom.description: external SSH private key to fetch with

token.description: plain text token to fetch with

username.description: plain text username to fetch with

tarball.description: tarballs to unpack

mount.description: should it mount a new volume there

path.description: path where the tarball should be extracted

url.description: url for the tarball to extract

async.description: only schedule the resources, don't watch the results (unless it is needed for parallelism)

parallelism.description: how many resources could be scheduled in parallel

count.description: static number of sharded instances to spawn

activeDeadlineSeconds.description:
Optional duration in seconds the pod may be active on the node relative to
StartTime before the system will actively try to mark it failed and kill associated containers.
Value must be a positive integer.

args.description: additional executor binary arguments

artifactRequest.description: artifact request body with test artifacts

masks.description: regexp to filter scraped artifacts, single or comma separated

omitFolderPerExecution.description: don't use a separate folder for execution artifacts

sharedBetweenPods.description: whether to share volume between pods

sidecarScraper.description: run scraper as pod sidecar container

storageClassName.description: artifact storage class name for container executor

useDefaultStorageClassName.description: whether to use default storage class name

volumeMountPath.description: artifact volume mount path for container executor

command.description: executor binary command

mapToVariables.description: whether we shoud map to variables from resource

reference.description:
LocalObjectReference contains enough information to let you locate the
referenced object inside the same namespace.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

mapToVariables.description: whether we shoud map to variables from resource

reference.description:
LocalObjectReference contains enough information to let you locate the
referenced object inside the same namespace.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

executePostRunScriptBeforeScraping.description: execute post run script before scraping (prebuilt executor only)

executionNamespace.description: namespace for test execution (Pro edition only)

image.description: container executor image

items.description:
LocalObjectReference contains enough information to let you locate the
referenced object inside the same namespace.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

negativeTest.description: negative test will fail the execution if it is a success and it will succeed if it is a failure

postRunScript.description: script to run after test execution

preRunScript.description: script to run before test execution

sourceScripts.description: run scripts using source command (container executor only)

sync.description: whether to start execution sync or async

valueFrom.description: or load it from var source

variablesFile.description: variables file content - need to be in format for particular executor (e.g. postman envs file)

matrix.description: matrix of parameters to spawn instances (static)

maxCount.description: dynamic number of sharded instances to spawn - it will be lowered if there is not enough sharded values

shards.description: parameters that should be distributed across sharded instances

tarball.description: pack some data from the original file system to serve them down

config.description: configuration to pass for the workflow

count.description: static number of sharded instances to spawn

description.description: test workflow execution description to display
